alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Kanawha; Putnam; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kanawha, northeastern Putnam, southwestern Roane and southeastern Jackson Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kenna, or 13 miles south of Ripley, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sissonville, Kenna, Amma, Left Hand, Looneyville, Harmony, Kentuck, Liberty, Walton and Gandeeville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 17 and 29. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 116 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for central, western, north central and northwestern West Virginia.
